title: Hospitals top list of SNGPL defaulters with Rs1.41 billion dues - Pakistan - DAWN.COM
content:
LAHORE: The Sui Northern Gas Pipelines Limited (SNGPL) management says several departments of provincial and federal governments are defaulters and are liable for paying bills amounting to Rs3.7136 billion for which the reminder notices have been issued for clearance of all dues immediately.

Among all defaulters, hospitals remain on top of the list with the total outstanding dues amounting to Rs1.4125bn, Dawn has learnt.

According to the company, the reminder notices have been issued to several public sector organisations and departments for the payment of dues. Therefore, the company urges all entities to settle their dues immediately to avoid further legal or administrative action. Final notices were earlier served on these defaulters during April 2025.

The hospitals under the federal government owe Rs183.62m, those under the Khyber Pakhtunkhwa (KP) government (Rs106.08m) and Punjab government hospitals owe Rs1.1228bn. The total outstanding dues from these hospitals amount to Rs1.4125bn.

Company issues reminders to defaulting depts after final notices for clearance of Rs3.71bn bills

The police department is also among the major defaulters. The federal police owe Rs141.5m, followed by KP police that owe Rs63.13m and Punjab police owing Rs295.04m, bringing the total outstanding dues from police departments to Rs499.7m.

In the prison sector, jails in KP owe Rs38.58m, while those in Punjab owe Rs569m. The total outstanding dues from jails come to Rs607.5m.

The Capital Development Authority (CDA) of the federal government owes Rs251.2m.

The Public Works Department (PWD) is another major defaulter. The federal PWD owes Rs118.46m, KP PWD (Rs5.028m), and Punjab PWD (Rs18.114m). The combined outstanding dues from all PWDs total Rs141.6m.

Educational institutions have also accumulated unpaid dues. Federal institutions owe Rs65.58m, KP institutions (Rs17.14m) and Punjab institutions (Rs32.554m). The total outstanding dues from educational institutions stand at Rs115.28m.

Miscellaneous government institutions owe substantial amounts as well. Federal institutions owe Rs198.88m, those in KP (Rs76.92m) and Punjab-based institutions (Rs410m). The total outstanding dues in this category amount to Rs685.8m.
